p:
Chiang et al.
144, 143 tested aqueous extracts of Plantago major and Plantago asiatica against HSV-1 (strain KOS) and HSV-2 (strain 196) in BCC-1/KMC cells. Both P. asiatica (EC 50 = 1318 μg/ml and SI = 46.5)
143 and P. major (EC 50 = 843 μg/ml and SI = 2.2)
144, 143 demonstrated antiviral activity against HSV-2, but neither extract was active against HSV-1. The authors described the observed antiviral activity as weak, therefore P. major and P. asiatica are likely poor candidates for further HSV research.
